verses.verse: And <WG2532> straightway <WG2112> in <WG1909> the morning <WG4404> the chief priests <WG749> with <WG3326> the elders <WG4245> and <WG2532> scribes <WG1122>, and <WG2532> the whole <WG3650> council <WG4892>, held <WG4160> a consultation <WG4824>, and bound <WG1210> Jesus <WG2424>, and carried <WG667> him away <WG667>, and <WG2532> delivered <WG3860> him up to Pilate <WG4091>.

And <WG2532> Pilate <WG4091> asked <WG1905> him <WG846>, Art <WG1488> thou <WG4771> the King <WG935> of the Jews <WG2453>? And <WG1161> he answering <WG611> saith <WG2036> unto him <WG846>, Thou <WG4771> sayest <WG3004>.
And <WG2532> the chief priests <WG749> accused <WG2723> him <WG846> of many things <WG4183>.

And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> again <WG3825> asked <WG1905> him <WG846>, saying <WG3756>, Answerest thou <WG611> nothing <WG3762>? behold <WG1492> how many things <WG4214> they accuse <WG2649> thee of <WG4675>.
But <WG1161> Jesus <WG2424> no <WG3762> more <WG3765> answered <WG611> anything <WG5620>; insomuch that Pilate <WG4091> marvelled <WG2296>.
Now <WG1161> at <WG2596> the feast <WG1859> he used to release <WG630> unto them <WG846> one <WG1520> prisoner <WG1198>, whom <WG3746> they asked of him <WG154>.

And <WG1161> there was <WG2258> one called <WG3004> Barabbas <WG912>, lying bound <WG1210> with <WG3326> them that <WG3588> had made insurrection <WG4955>, men who <WG3748> in <WG1722> the insurrection <WG4714> had committed <WG4160> murder <WG5408>.
And <WG2532> the multitude <WG3793> went up and <WG2532> began <WG756> to ask <WG2531> him to do as <WG2531> he was <WG4160> wont <WG104> to do <WG4160> unto them <WG846>.
And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> answered <WG611> them <WG846>, saying <WG3004>, Will ye <WG2309> that I release <WG630> unto you <WG5213> the King <WG935> of the Jews <WG2453>?
For <WG1063> he perceived <WG1097> that <WG3754> for <WG1223> envy <WG5355> the chief priests <WG749> had delivered <WG3860> him up <WG846>.
But <WG1161> the chief priests <WG749> stirred <WG383> up the multitude <WG3793>, that <WG2443> he should <WG630> rather <WG3123> release <WG630> Barabbas <WG912> unto them <WG846>.

And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> again <WG3825> answered <WG611> and said <WG2036> unto them <WG846>, What <WG5101> then <WG3767> shall I do <WG4160> unto him whom <WG3739> ye <WG2309> call <WG3004> the King <WG935> of the Jews <WG2453>?
And <WG1161> they cried out <WG2896> again <WG3825>, Crucify <WG4717> him <WG846>.

And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> said <WG3004> unto them <WG846>, Why <WG5101>, what <WG1063> evil <WG2556> hath he done <WG4160>? But <WG1161> they cried out <WG2896> exceedingly <WG4056>, Crucify <WG4717> him <WG846>.

And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091>, wishing <WG1014> to <WG4160> content <WG2425> the multitude <WG3793>, released <WG630> unto them <WG846> Barabbas <WG912>, and <WG2532> delivered <WG3860> Jesus <WG2424>, when he had scourged <WG5417> him <WG2443>, to be crucified <WG4717>.

And <WG1161> the soldiers <WG4757> led <WG520> him <WG846> away <WG520> within <WG2080> the court <WG3739>, which <WG2076> is the Praetorium <WG4232>; and <WG2532> they call together <WG4779> the whole <WG3650> band <WG4686>.
And <WG2532> they clothe <WG1746> him <WG846> with purple <WG4209>, and <WG2532> platting a crown <WG4735> of thorns <WG174>, they <WG2532> put it on <WG4060> him <WG846>;
and <WG2532> they began <WG756> to salute <WG782> him <WG846>, Hail <WG5463>, King <WG935> of the Jews <WG2453>!

And <WG2532> they smote <WG5180> his <WG5180> head <WG2776> with a reed <WG2563>, and <WG2532> spat <WG1716> upon him <WG846>, and <WG2532> bowing <WG5087> their knees <WG1119> worshipped <WG4352> him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> when <WG3753> they had mocked <WG1702> him <WG846>, they took off <WG1562> from <WG1562> him <WG846> the purple <WG4209>, and <WG2532> put <WG1746> on him <WG846> his <WG2398> garments <WG2440>. And <WG2532> they lead <WG1806> him <WG846> out <WG1806> to <WG2443> crucify <WG4717> him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> they compel <WG29> one <WG5100> passing by <WG3855>, Simon <WG4613> of Cyrene <WG2956>, coming from <WG2064> the <WG575> country <WG68>, the father <WG3962> of Alexander <WG223> and <WG2532> Rufus <WG4504>, to <WG2443> go with them <WG142>, that he might bear his <WG846> cross <WG4716>.
And <WG2532> they bring <WG5342> him <WG846> unto <WG1909> the place <WG5117> Golgotha <WG1115>, which <WG3739> is <WG2076>, being interpreted <WG3177>, The place <WG5117> of a skull <WG2898>.
And <WG2532> they offered <WG1325> him <WG846> wine <WG3631> mingled with myrrh <WG4669>: but <WG1161> he received <WG2983> it <WG4095> not <WG3756>.

And <WG2532> they crucify <WG4717> him <WG846>, and <WG2532> part his <WG846> garments <WG2440> among them <WG846>, casting <WG906> lots <WG2819> upon <WG1909> them <WG846>, what <WG5101> each should take <WG142>.

And <WG2532> with <WG4862> him <WG846> they crucify <WG4717> two <WG1417> robbers <WG3027>; one <WG1520> on <WG1537> his right hand <WG1188>, and <WG2532> one <WG1537> on <WG1537> his <WG846> left <WG2176>.

And <WG2532> they that <WG3588> passed by <WG3899> railed on <WG987> him <WG846>, wagging <WG2795> their <WG846> heads <WG2776>, and <WG2532> saying <WG3004>, Ha <WG3758>! save <WG4982> thyself <WG4572>, and <WG2532> come down <WG2597> from <WG575> the cross <WG4716>.

In like <WG3668> manner also <WG2532> the chief priests <WG749> mocking <WG1702> him among <WG4314> themselves <WG240> with <WG3326> the scribes <WG1122> said <WG3004>, He saved <WG4982> others <WG243>; himself <WG1438> he <WG1410> cannot <WG3756> save <WG4982>.

Let the Christ <WG5547>, the King <WG935> of Israel <WG2474>, now <WG3568> come down <WG575> from <WG575> the cross <WG4716>, that <WG2443> we may see <WG1492> and <WG2532> believe <WG4100>. And <WG2532> they that <WG3588> were crucified <WG4957> with him <WG846> reproached <WG3679> him <WG846>.

And <WG1161> when the sixth <WG1623> hour <WG5610> was come <WG1096>, there was <WG1096> darkness <WG4655> over <WG1909> the whole <WG3650> land <WG1093> until <WG2193> the ninth <WG1766> hour <WG5610>.

And <WG2532> at the ninth <WG1766> hour <WG5610> Jesus <WG2424> cried <WG994> with a loud <WG3173> voice <WG5456>, Eloi <WG1682>, Eloi <WG1682>, lama <WG2982> sabachthani <WG4518>? which <WG3739> is <WG2076>, being interpreted <WG3177>, My <WG3450> God <WG2316>, my <WG3450> God <WG2316>, why <WG5101> hast thou forsaken <WG1459> me <WG1519>?
And <WG2532> some <WG5100> of them that <WG3588> stood by <WG3936>, when they heard <WG191> it <WG3004>, said, Behold <WG2400>, he calleth <WG5455> Elijah <WG2243>.

And <WG1161> one <WG1520> ran <WG5143>, and <WG2532> filling <WG1072> a sponge <WG4699> full <WG1072> of vinegar <WG3690>, put <WG4060> it on a reed <WG2563>, and <WG5037> gave <WG4222> him <WG846> to drink <WG4222>, saying <WG3004>, Let be <WG863>; let us see <WG1492> whether <WG1487> Elijah <WG2243> cometh <WG2064> to take <WG2507> him <WG846> down <WG2507>.
And <WG1161> Jesus <WG2424> uttered <WG863> a loud <WG3173> voice <WG5456>, and gave up the ghost <WG1606>.
And <WG2532> the veil <WG2665> of the temple <WG3485> was rent <WG4977> in <WG1519> two <WG1417> from <WG575> the top <WG509> to <WG2193> the bottom <WG2736>.

And <WG1161> when the centurion <WG2760>, who <WG3588> stood <WG3936> by over <WG1537> against <WG1727> him <WG846>, saw <WG1492> that <WG3754> he <WG2896> so <WG3779> gave <WG2896> up the ghost <WG1606>, he said <WG2036>, Truly <WG230> this <WG3778> man <WG444> was <WG2258> the Son <WG5207> of God <WG2316>.

who <WG3739>, <WG2532> when <WG3753> he was <WG2258> in <WG1722> Galilee <WG1056>, followed <WG190> him <WG846>, and <WG2532> ministered <WG1247> unto him <WG846>; and <WG2532> many <WG4183> other women <WG243> that <WG3588> came up <WG4872> with him <WG846> unto <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2414>.

there came Joseph <WG2501> of <WG575> Arimathaea <WG707>, a councillor <WG1010> of honorable <WG2158> estate <WG3739>, who also <WG2532> himself <WG846> was looking <WG4327> for <WG2258> the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316>; and he boldly <WG5111> went <WG2064> in <WG1525> unto <WG4314> Pilate <WG4091>, and <WG2532> asked <WG154> for the body <WG4983> of Jesus <WG2424>.

And <WG1161> Pilate <WG4091> marvelled <WG2296> if <WG1487> he were <WG2348> already <WG2235> dead <WG2348>: and <WG2532> calling <WG4341> unto him the centurion <WG2760>, he asked <WG1905> him <WG846> whether <WG1487> he had been <WG599> any while <WG3819> dead <WG599>.
And <WG2532> when he learned <WG1097> it of <WG575> the centurion <WG2760>, he granted <WG1433> the corpse <WG4983> to Joseph <WG2501>.

And <WG2532> he bought <WG59> a linen <WG4616> cloth <WG2532>, and taking <WG2507> him <WG846> down <WG2507>, wound him in <WG1750> the linen <WG4616> cloth <WG2532>, and laid <WG2698> him <WG846> in <WG1722> a tomb <WG3419> which <WG3739> had been <WG2258> hewn <WG2998> out of <WG1537> a rock <WG4073>; and <WG2532> he rolled <WG4351> a stone <WG3037> against <WG1909> the door <WG2374> of the tomb <WG3419>.
